text.p: Novell Inc said Thursday it had launched GroupWise 5, its extended client/serve electronic mail system.
The company said the system's pricing would be the same as GroupWise 4.1

It said the new version of GroupWise, an electronic messaging and workgroup application software, has a new Universal Mail Box feature, which lets users have one single place to access their calendar, group scheduling, voice mail, and electronic mail, via a corporate network or the Internet.
GroupWise 5 supports Internet standards, plus the software can be customized for internal corporate "intranets" networks.

GroupWise 5 will start at $718 for a five-user license and goes to $32,625 for a 250-user license. GroupWise client versions for Microsoft's Windows 95, Windows NT and Windows 3.1 will be available in the third week of October.
